events.message: The customer reported a recent vehicle collision that occurred on April 29th and filed a claim for the damages sustained by their car.
The claim was reviewed by the intake department and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case promptly in order to provide personalized support and guide the customer through the claims process.
The customer received official acknowledgment confirming the insurance company has begun processing their auto accident claim.
The company requested detailed documents including the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from an authorized garage.
All requested documents were submitted by the customer, including the police report and multiple repair cost estimates for the damages.
A thorough investigation was initiated to verify the accident details, validate the submitted documents, and assess liability accordingly.
The investigation concluded successfully with confirmation that the customer’s vehicle was indeed damaged in a covered accident under the policy.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the damage assessment and policy terms, sent to the customer for review and approval.
The customer responded positively indicating acceptance of the settlement offer and expressed appreciation for the smooth communication throughout the process.
Management approved the claim payment following the customer’s acceptance of the proposed settlement amount.
The agreed settlement payment was issued successfully to the customer's designated bank account without delays.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after confirming payment receipt and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim records and related documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
